page.name: xaf/dialogs/skins
page.summary: XAF separates presentation from forms design and logic by automatically creating all HTML and DHTML in user-defined "skin" objects. The skins perform all drawing operations while the forms objects manage all of the fields and validation. One immediate benefit of skins is the ability to design and describe a dialog once and exectute it on mobile, small form- factors (handhelds), notebooks, and desktops.

section.heading: Sample of the Same Dialog Rendering Using Different Skins

page.section: All aspects of the visual rendering of a Dialog (colors, fonts, layout, etc.) are controlled using Java-based skins. Skins can be either XSLT-based, pure Java, or any combination that is required by the programmer.
